subtitle: These stuffed peppers make a surprisingly filling lunch. They are also a good vegetable accompaniment to any simply cooked meat or fish dish.

method.text: Put the bulgar wheat and couscous in a bowl. Pour over the boiling water. Cover the bowl with cling film. Leave to soak for 30 min, or until all the water has been absorbed and the grains softened.
Cut the tops off the peppers and reserve. Remove the core, seeds and membranes. Blanch the shells in boiling water for about 2 min. Drain and cool.

Heat the oil in a frying pan and fry the shallots and garlic gently for 2-3 min until softened. Add the courgettes and chopped pepper tops. Fry for 2 min. Stir in the tomatoes, tomato puree and seasoning and simmer for about 10-15 min until thickened.

Add the bulgar mixture, parsley and cashew nuts to the tomato mixture. Stir well. Use the mixture to fill the peppers. Spoon any remaining filling in to the bottom of an ovenproof dish and place the peppers on top.
Sprinkle over the cheese. Cover with foil. Bake in the oven for 30 min, or until tender.

title: Bulgar and tomato stuffed baked peppers
